nodes.label: Algorithmic Strategies
nodes.title: Algorithmic Strategies: Algorithmic Strategies covers various approaches and techniques used to design and analyze algorithms

nodes.label: Recursive
nodes.title: Recursive: Algorithms that solve problems by calling themselves with smaller input instances until a base case is reached.

nodes.label: Decrease-and-Conquer
nodes.title: Decrease-and-Conquer: Algorithms that reduce a problem instance to a smaller instance of the same problem, solve the smaller instance, and then use the solution to solve the original problem.

nodes.label: Divide-and-Conquer
nodes.title: Divide-and-Conquer: A problem-solving technique that breaks a problem into smaller subproblems, solves the subproblems recursively, and then combines the solutions to solve the original problem.

nodes.label: Fundamental Data Structures and Algorithms
nodes.title: Fundamental Data Structures and Algorithms: including arrays, linked lists, trees, sorting and searching algorithms

nodes.label: Cryptography: AES (SHA-256), RSA
nodes.title: Cryptography: AES (SHA-256), RSA: secure encryption and decryption techniques widely used for securing data transmission and storage

nodes.label: Graphs [MF/Graphs and Trees]
nodes.title: Graphs [MF/Graphs and Trees]: a fundamental data structure

nodes.label: Adjacency List and Matrix representations
nodes.title: Adjacency List and Matrix representations: Methods used to store and represent graphs in computer memory

nodes.label: Recursion
nodes.title: Recursion: A programming technique where a function calls itself in order to solve problems that can be broken down into smaller, similar subproblems.

nodes.label: Recursive Algoritms
nodes.title: Recursive Algoritms: Algorithms that solve problems by breaking them down into smaller instances of the same problem until a base case is reached.

nodes.label: Multiplicative Groups
nodes.title: Multiplicative Groups: Multiplicative Groups: Multiplicative groups arise from certain sets of elements equipped with multiplication as the binary operation.

nodes.label: RSA
nodes.title: RSA: RSA (Rivest-Shamir-Adleman) is a widely used public-key encryption algorithm based on the difficulty of factoring large prime numbers.

nodes.label: Representing Graphs and Graph Isomorphisms
nodes.title: Representing Graphs and Graph Isomorphisms: Representing Graphs and Graph Isomorphisms: Graphs can be represented using various data structures, such as adjacency matrices or adjacency lists. Graph isomorphism deals with determining whether two graphs are structurally identical, despite differences in vertex labeling or edge orientation.
